import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T
from pyspark.sql.window import Window

def anomaly_detection_classifier(df,
                                 filter_column_1, 
                                 filter_column_2, 
                                 cost_column,
                                 filter_tag,
                                 window_size=30):

    
    # # Selecting the filter-categories (Subscription and Meter Category), the time-stamp and the cost data
    # costs_by_dates = df.select(filter_column_1, filter_column_2, 'Date', cost_column)

    # Setting a partition window to divide the dataset in the filter options and order it by the Date
    windowSpec = Window.partitionBy(filter_column_1, filter_column_2).orderBy('Date').rowsBetween(-window_size, 0)

    # Define column-names
    ma_col_name = f'MovingAverage_{filter_tag}'
    std_col_name = f'MovingStdDev_{filter_tag}'

    # Set a moving average that is set by the n previous days
    costs_by_dates = df.withColumn(ma_col_name, F.avg(F.col(cost_column)).over(windowSpec))

    # Set a moving standard deviation of the same period
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(std_col_name, F.stddev(F.col(cost_column)).over(windowSpec))

    # Define column-names
    std1 = f'1StdDev_{filter_tag}'
    std2 = f'2StdDev_{filter_tag}'
    std3 = f'3StdDev_{filter_tag}'

    # Set upper thresholds with a standard deviation multiplied by 'n' higher than the moving average
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(std1, F.col(ma_col_name) + F.col(std_col_name))
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(std2, F.col(ma_col_name) + (F.col(std_col_name) * 2))
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(std3, F.col(ma_col_name) + (F.col(std_col_name) * 3))

    # If the cost is more than the threshold set, then set the datapoint to be 1, otherwise 0
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(f'Above_1std_{filter_tag}', F.when(F.col(cost_column) > F.col(std1), F.lit(1))\
                                                                            .otherwise(F.lit(0)))

    # If the cost is more than the threshold set, then set the datapoint to be 1, otherwise 0
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(f'Above_2std_{filter_tag}', F.when(F.col(cost_column) > F.col(std2), F.lit(1))\
                                                                            .otherwise(F.lit(0)))

    # If the cost is more than the threshold set, then set the datapoint to be 1, otherwise 0
    costs_by_dates = costs_by_dates.withColumn(f'Above_3std_{filter_tag}', F.when(F.col(cost_column) > F.col(std3), F.lit(1))\
                                                                            .otherwise(F.lit(0)))

    return costs_by_dates

source_path = "abfss://usage@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/aggregate/parquet/Extended_ACMMonthlyAmortizedCost_overview_OneYear.parquet"

print(f"Reading data from: {source_path}")
df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(source_path)


print("Running the Anomaly Detection Classifier for Subscription-partitioned data")
costs_by_dates =  anomaly_detection_classifier(df=df,
                                               filter_column_1='SubscriptionId',
                                               filter_column_2='MeterCategory',
                                               cost_column='CostInBillingCurrency',
                                               filter_tag='Subscription',
                                               window_size=30)

print("Running the Anomaly Detection Classifier for WBS-partitioned data")
costs_by_dates =  anomaly_detection_classifier(df=costs_by_dates,
                                               filter_column_1='ActiveWBS',
                                               filter_column_2='MeterCategory',
                                               cost_column='CostInBillingCurrency',
                                               filter_tag='WBS',
                                               window_size=30)

destination_path = "abfss://usage@s037costmgmt.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/aggregate/parquet/Extended_ACMMonthlyAmortizedCost_overview_OneYear.parquet"

print(f"Writing classification data to this path: {destination_path}")
